title: Mkt. for grain in Country X before and after trade

content.description:
The diagram above illustrates the domestic market for grain in Country X before and after international trade. The letters inside the diagram represent areas, not points.

Using the labeling of the graph, identify each of the following before any trade occurs.

Equilibrium price and quantity

Area of consumer surplus

Area of producer surplus

Using the labeling of the graph, identify the amount of grain that Country X will import if it engages in trade and the world price of grain is at PW.

Now assume that Country X imposes a tariff that raises the price of grain from the free-trade case to PT. Using the labeling of the graph, identify the change in each of the following.

Domestic production

Domestic consumption

Consumer surplus

Producer surplus
content.question: Respond to all parts of the question.

frqParts.text: Respond to all parts of the question.

topic.text: 2.6: Market Equilibrium and Consumer and Producer Surplus

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Using economic concepts, principles, or models, explain how a specific economic outcome occurs, or what action should be taken in order to achieve a specific economic outcome.
